N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4000.2 - Arbitration requests

State Regulations

Arbitration may be initiated by a written request to the

State Mediation Board which shall include: (a) The complete names, addresses and
telephone numbers of both parties (and the international affiliation of the
labor organization). (b) The names, addresses and telephone numbers of the attorneys (if any) representing each
party. (c) The text of the contract
clause providing for arbitration and the date the contract expires, or a
written submission signed by both parties, designating the board as the
arbitration agency. (d) A statement
of the specific issue to be arbitrated, including names of the persons to be
affected by the arbitrator's award. (e) A statement or indication that a copy of
the request for arbitration has been served on the other side. (f) The signature and title of the person
filing the request for arbitration. Notes
